docs.title: Build venv for MacOS
docs.text:
$ python3.10 -m venv venv
$ source venv/bin/activate
$ pip install -r requirements.txt
$ deactivate
$ rm -rf venv     # remove the venv

docs.title: Build venv for Windows
docs.text:
$ pip install virtualenv
$ virtualenv venv
$ venv\Scripts\activate
$ pip install -r requirements.txt
$ deactivate
$ rmdir /s venv     # remove the venv

docs.title: Forking this Repository:
docs.text: Fork the chatter-judge repository into your own workspace.

docs.title: Cloning the Repository to Your Workspace:
Setting Upstream Remote:
docs.text:
$ git remote add upstream git@github.com:1chooo/chatter-judge.git

$ git remote -v
origin  git@github.com:<your_user_name>/chatter-judge.git (fetch)
origin  git@github.com:<your_user_name>/chatter-judge.git (push)
upstream        git@github.com:1chooo/chatter-judge.git (fetch)
upstream        git@github.com:1chooo/chatter-judge.git (push)

docs.title: Pull Requests:
docs.text: If you have any valuable ideas to contribute, please create a pull request and provide details about the outstanding work you've done.

docs.title: Issue Reporting:
docs.text: If you encounter any problems while contributing to this project, please report the issues in the chatter-judge/issues section.

docs.title: Make sure to synchronize and update your repository before initiating a pull request:
docs.text:
1. Run git stash save to temporarily stash your local changes.
  2. Run git fetch upstream to sync the source project with your local copy.
  3. Run git checkout main to switch to the main branch.
  4. Run git merge upstream/main to merge the updated remote version into your local copy. If there are no conflicts, the update process is complete.
  5. Run git stash pop to apply your temporarily stashed changes back to your working directory. Resolve any conflicts if necessary.

docs.title: Build venv for MacOS
docs.text:
